docs.snippet: President Barack Obama said Tuesday that the U.S. will do everything it can to help Nigeria find nearly 300 teenage girls missing since they were kidnapped from school three weeks ago by an Islamist extremist group that has threatened to sell them...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama said Tuesday that the U.S. will do everything it can to help Nigeria find nearly 300 teenage girls missing since they were kidnapped from school three weeks ago by an Islamist extremist group that has threatened to sell them.

headline.main: Obama: US to Help Nigeria Find Kidnapped Girls
headline.print_headline: Obama: US to Help Nigeria Find Kidnapped Girls

docs.snippet: The leaders of South Sudan's two warring sides are likely to meet face to face this week, U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said during a visit to the country on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The leaders of South Sudan's two warring sides are likely to meet face to face this week, U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said during a visit to the country on Tuesday.

headline.main: UN Chief: South Sudan's Warring Leaders Will Meet
headline.print_headline: UN Chief: South Sudan's Warring Leaders Will Meet

docs.snippet: President Jose Mujica signed the long-awaited rules for Uruguay's legal pot marketplace Tuesday, launching a rollout that should stock pharmacies with government-approved marijuana cigarettes for sale by year's end....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Jose Mujica signed the long-awaited rules for Uruguay's legal pot marketplace Tuesday, launching a rollout that should stock pharmacies with government-approved marijuana cigarettes for sale by year's end.

docs.snippet: The effort to get assistance to the hardest-hit in Abi Barak was being hampered by a lack of effective management at the site of the landslide....
docs.lead_paragraph: The effort to get assistance to the hardest-hit in Abi Barak was being hampered by a lack of effective management at the site of the landslide.
docs.abstract: Effort to get assistance to those hardest hit by a devastating landslide in Abi Barak, Afghanistan, is being hampered by host of problems, including competing interests among local leaders and politicians and lack of infrastructure and effective management; landslide is likely to have claimed 2,100 lives and has left thousands homeless.

headline.main: Lack of Orderly Means to Distribute Aid Is Latest Setback for Afghan Village
headline.print_headline: Lack of Orderly Means to Distribute Aid Is Latest Setback for Afghan Village

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies

byline.original: By HABIB ZAHORI and AZAM AHMED

docs.snippet: As fans at the Italian Cup final seemed on the verge of boiling over, the police and the captain of one team approached the leader of a hard-core group of supporters in what was called a “grotesque” meeting....
docs.lead_paragraph: As fans at the Italian Cup final seemed on the verge of boiling over, the police and the captain of one team approached the leader of a hard-core group of supporters in what was called a “grotesque” meeting.
docs.abstract: Italian Interior Min Angelino Alfano denies that police sought permission from Gennaro de Tommaso, leader of hard-core supporters of soccer team Napoli, to start final of the prestigious Italian Cup; still, images captured on live television were damning, and de Tommaso is suspected of having ties to organized crime; many analysts say the Italian authorities have never really confronted problem of soccer hooliganism.

headline.main: Pride of Italy Takes a Dive as Soccer ‘Ultras’ Gain Control
headline.print_headline: Italian Soccer Takes a Dive as Hooligans Gain Control
